incidents.name: Call Quality Problems to a Subset of Twilio's UK Numbers

incident_updates.body: The issue affecting voice quality when calling to a subset of Twilio's UK phone numbers has been resolved, and the service is functioning normally at this time.

Our carrier partner informed that the issue was mitigated on their end. We are still observing improvements in voice quality when calling to a subset of Twilio's UK phone numbers. incidents.name: Failure to Retrieve Trial Phone Numbers during New Account Onboarding

incident_updates.body: The issue with provisioning trial phone numbers has been resolved and phone number provisioning is operating normally at this time.

Our engineers have identified that there were some numbers in bad state which were causing this issue for a select few instances during number instances. This is not something that is impacting our all customers. 

Phone Number Provisioning is operating normally. And we continue to monitor for system stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue unable to get trial phone numbers provisioned and are working to deploy a fix. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: SMS Outgoing Traffic Impacted

incident_updates.body: The effects of this incident have completely passed through the system and all traffic is operating normally. This incident has been resolved. In addition to the previously described expected error codes of Validity Period Expired (30036) and Twilio Internal Error (30500), a large portion of affected messages were finalized to a Failed status (note Failed not Undelivered) with error code 30008 (Unknown Error).

We continue monitoring remaining queued messages. Overall, the system has reached a normal steady state; Now, most messages are sending without any additional queueing delay. However, individual customers may see messages remaining in queues due to large numbers of messages enqueued during this incident. We expect any messages delayed during this incident to have fully propagated through to a final status over the course of the next several hours. Note that we expect that some messages will eventually timeout and fail due to Validity Period Expired (error code 30036), others may eventually fail due to a Twilio Internal Error (error code 30500).
We will provide an update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue monitoring remaining queued messages. Overall, the system has reached a normal steady state; Now, most messages are sending without any additional queueing delay. However, individual customers may see messages remaining in queues due to large numbers of messages enqueued during this incident. We expect any messages delayed during this incident to have fully propagated through to a final status over the course of the next several hours. Note that we expect that some messages will eventually timeout and fail due to Validity Period Expired (error code 30036), others may eventually fail due to a Twilio Internal Error (error code 30500).
We will provide an update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue monitoring remaining queued messages. Overall, the system has reached a normal steady state; Now, most messages are sending without any additional queueing delay. However, individual customers may see messages remaining in queues due to large numbers of messages enqueued during this incident. We expect any messages delayed during this incident to have fully propagated through to a final status over the course of the next several hours. Note that we expect that some messages will eventually timeout and fail due to Validity Period Expired (error code 30036), others may eventually fail due to a Twilio Internal Error (error code 30500).
We will provide an update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are continuing to monitor remaining queued messages. Overall, the system has reached a normal steady state; Now, most messages are sending without any additional queueing delay. However, individual customers may see messages remaining in queues due to large numbers of messages enqueued during this incident. We expect any messages delayed during this incident to have fully propagated through to a final status over the course of the next several hours. Note that we expect that some messages will eventually timeout and fail due to Validity Period Expired (error code 30036), others may eventually fail due to a Twilio Internal Error (error code 30500).
We will provide an update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are continuing to monitor remaining queued messages. Overall, the system has reached a normal steady state; Now, most messages are sending without any additional queueing delay. incidents.name: Super SIM Network Connectivity Issues within US for a subset of customers

incident_updates.body: Super SIM connectivity issues within the US for a subset of customers have been resolved, and the service is now operating normally at this time.

We are now seeing recovery of the network connectivity issue. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing Super SIM connectivity issues within the US on the AT&T network. This is impacting a portion of AT&T's network due to a change they made earlier today. We are monitoring the situation as the roaming network works to resolve the issue. If you find your devices are not properly connecting in the US right now you may want to try removing AT&T from your Network Access Profile to see if connectivity improves. We will provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Customers Unable to Input Sender ID Application in Console

incident_updates.body: The Sender ID application section in Console was degraded between 11:55 Pacific Time on 03/20/2024 and 07:07 Pacific Time on 03/22/2024. During this period of time customers may have experienced that the input field was not visible when specific countries were selected. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: DialogFlow EX/CS are experiencing issues with <Gather> speech and <VirtualAgent>

incident_updates.body: Service degradations with Virtual Agent in US East and <Gather> Speech that affected all regions has been resolved and is operating normally at this time.

Twilio Engineering has isolated the problem which caused a service degradation with Virtual Agent in US East and <Gather> Speech that affected all regions.  We are seeing recovery for customers.  We will be monitoring all services to ensure a full recovery and will provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as the information becomes available.
